intro: Gymnosporia cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf burr bush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers followed by woody, spiny fruits that contain seeds. Gymnosporia cuneifolia is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it resilient to drought conditions. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
